reviewText:
Early Access Review

✘ A Confused Space ShooterPre-Release, Early Access Review - Updated: December 30, 2015

TLDR: A space shooter that takes itself too seriously with no real objectives to make up the difference.


Good
❤ Solid sound, especially during battles
❤ Space station graphics details are nice


Bad
✘ Mission update text disappears too quickly to read
✘ No voiceovers at all
✘ Static background with scrolling effects feels a bit nauseous and doesn't flow well
✘ Objectives are lackluster and provide no real sense of urgency or mission


ConclusionI honestly was excited firing the game up, but immediately became overwhelmed by the frequency of mission text on the bottom of the screen and undewhelmed by the lack of real mission or objective. The tutorial starts you in a hanger, shows you the controls and 10 seconds later your station is attacked. You are then led on a series of short mini-mission objectives wherein you go through a few wormholes, dodge asteroids, fight a few stray enemies, and then it's on to the next mission.

If this game had minimal voice acting it would help tone the difficulty down to match the gameplay. If the game remarketed itself as a more intense shooter and less of an RPG-esque play style, I believe it would be successful. As it is now, however, not worth the space credits.


(If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up ❤)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A.I. Space Corps currently has many flaws, some of them really negatively impact on the gameplay experience.
This title can possibly be salvaged, but for the current amount of issues and lack of content with the price tag, I would avoid this for now.
Watch my review below for an in depth look, and feedback for the Devs to hopefully correct some issues. It is in Early access after all.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xPJK8yTDXYE

reviewText:
Early Access Review

[h]A Twin-Stick Shooter in Space[/h1]
https://youtu.be/0qxxBYLSQFw
+ Certain stages have great looking backgrounds
+ A variety of interesting levels
+ A mix of gameplay, it's not all just shooting sometimes you have to survive a barrage of asteroids, one mission you are stuck in a wormhole, etc.
+ A mix of special abilities like rockets, healing, and an electromagnetic field
+ You can upgrade your main gun with power-ups

This game is in Early Access so don't take these negatives too seriously
- The story is lacking, kind of hard to tell what the premise is besides kill the A.I."
- Too much text dialogue during gameplay
date: it's very hard to read while shooting at enemies\n- There's 3 ships but they vary "slightly" in movement speed
recommended: and shields... It would be neat if they each had unique abilities and weapons.\n- Kind of lackluster endings to each level
hoursPlayed: it would be nice if there was some sort of reward or upgrade system for completing each mission."

reviewText: Pretty good game, It's easy to play and not too hard, quite relaxing. Recommend to people who want to have a few hours of fun but don't want to get too serious.
